definitions.definition: To sit in judgment on; to pass sentence on.
definitions.example: A higher power will judge you after you are dead.

definitions.definition: To sit in judgment, to act as judge.
definitions.example: Justices in this country judge without appeal.
I judge a man’s character by the cut of his suit.

definitions.definition: To arbitrate; to pass opinion on something, especially to settle a dispute etc.
definitions.example: We cannot both be right: you must judge between us.

definitions.definition: To have as an opinion; to consider, suppose.
definitions.example: I judge it safe to leave the house once again.

definitions.definition: To form an opinion; to infer.
definitions.example: I judge from the sky that it might rain later.

definitions.definition: To criticize or label another person or thing.
